abstract: The administration has sacrificed a crucial relationship with Iraq at the altar of a dangerous policy on Iran.
lead_paragraph: Americans will debate the American drone strike that killed the Iranian commander Maj. Gen. Qassim Suleimani for a long time: whether it was wise, what it means for the Middle East, and how to proceed. But so far, the most dramatic consequences have arisen from where the strike happened â€” in Iraq. It appears that in undertaking the strike, the Trump administration may have sacrificed a valuable American counterterrorism partnership with Iraq at the altar of a risky pressure campaign against Iran with no end in sight.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
